poem.title: Radio Caroline
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: The crew I can imagine: fresh and hopeful As the queue of singles waiting to be spun. But as to how a record deck could work on the North Sea swell I have no clue. Did they have A billiard table too, in the mess? the balls adrift Like spirit-level bubbles, space invaders, The cue - a lumbering, predigital cursor? And a cow called Caroline on deck To grow grass in the cowpats.
